intro: Platystemon proximus, commonly known as the narrowleaf platystemon, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. The plant has slender, upright stems with small, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pale blue or violet, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Platystemon proximus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
